isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - INSTALL - OUTPUT YOKE AND OIL SEAL

step1.para: Inspect the bore for the seal in the output bearing retainer and the seal journal on the output yoke for wear or damage. Replace the retainer if worn or damaged.

Lubricate the outer surface of the output bearing retainer where the seal is installed with the oil that is used in the transmission. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

caution.para: Hold the seal only on the outer diameter. Do not touch the inner diameter of the seal. Touching contaminates the inner diameter of the seal and causes a leak between the shaft and the seal.

step1.para: Install the oil seal in the output bearing retainer.

caution.para: Use only the specified seal driver tool. If a different driver tool is used, the seal will not be installed at the correct depth and will leak.

step1.para: Use seal driver tool, ZTSE-4424, to install the seal. Clean and inspect the tool. Replace the tool if the area that touches the seal is worn or damaged (Figure 347).
On 115 and 125 Series transmission, use the sleeve inside the seal driver tool.
On 135, 145 and 155 Series transmissions, remove the sleeve from the inside of the seal driver tool.
Clean the seal driver tool. Put the oil seal on the seal driver tool so that the spring is away from the tool. Make sure the seal is flat against the surface of the tool (Figure 348).

figure.caption: Figure 348. Put Oil Seal on Tool So Spring is Away From Tool

step1.para: Drive the seal into the retainer until the flange on the tool touches the retainer. Make sure there are not gaps between the tool and the retainer.

caution.para: Use a cleaning solvent to clean the yoke. Do not use a crocus cloth to polish the journal of the yoke. If a crocus cloth is used, the seal will leak.

step1.para: Clean the yoke with a cleaning solvent. Lubricate the journal and splines in the yoke with the oil that is used in the transmission.

caution.para: Make sure the speedometer drive gear or tone ring is correctly installed or the output shaft seal may be damaged when the yoke is installed.

step1.para: Install the speedometer drive gear or tone ring on the yoke.
Install the yoke on the output shaft. Put a holding tool on the yoke (Figure 349).

caution.para: Do not tighten the yoke nut more than 678 Nm (500 ft-lbs) or the output bearing will be damaged.

step1.para: Install a new nut that fastens the yoke on the output shaft. Tighten the nut to 610 to 678 Nm (450 to 500 ft-lbs.) (Figure 349).

figure.caption: Figure 349. Install New Nut Fastening Yoke on Output Shaft
